Reduced poverty and inequality: Access to education can help people from disadvantaged backgrounds to improve their socio-economic status and contribute to a more equitable society.
Improved public health: Better education can lead to a healthier population, as individuals with access to education are more likely to engage in healthier behaviors.
Enhanced civic participation: Education can foster a sense of civic responsibility and encourage people to participate in their communities.
Increased global connectivity: Free education can promote cultural exchange and understanding, leading to a more connected and peaceful world.
Environmental sustainability: An educated population is more likely to be environmentally conscious and make informed decisions about resource use.
